item.title: Object not replaced with new given object ID, how do I replace it?
item.dc:creator: @relmitos relmitos
item.description:
@relmitos wrote:

Try this instead.

if(objectID == 7049 || objectID == 7050){
    ReplaceObject(objectX, objectY, -1, 0, 0);
}

Read full topic
item.source: Object not replaced with new given object ID, how do I replace it?

item.title: Object not replaced with new given object ID, how do I replace it?
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Bigbucks Mod Bigbucks
item.description:
@Mod_Bigbucks wrote:

I am wanting my wooden gate in the Falador farm to open, but for some reason it’s not doing so. In my batch program I get this output:

[client-1-Test]: atObject: 3021,3306 objectID: 7050
[client-1-Test]: atObject: 3021,3305 objectID: 7049

I’ve taken those details and applied them in the client.java file where all the other if statements about the objectIDs are:

	if(objectID == (7049 | 7050) && ((objectX == 3021 && objectY == 3305) || (objectX == 3021 && objectY == 3306) || (objectX == 3020 && objectY == 3306) || (objectX == 3020 && objectY == 3305))) { // Wooden gate
		ReplaceObject(objectX, objectY, 7052, -1, 0);

		// FACE: 0= WEST | -1 = NORTH | -2 = EAST | -3 = SOUTH
		// ObjectType: 0-3 wall objects, 4-8 wall decoration, 9: diag.
		// walls, 10-11 world objects, 12-21: roofs, 22: floor decoration
	}

Any reason why the gate is not opening for me?

Read full topic
item.source: Object not replaced with new given object ID, how do I replace it?
